list.event: Wounded are placed on supply-wains. Move slowly to protect the wounded. Begin trek down the Southward Road, away from the rubble of the Morannon. Scouts follow retreating enemies to assure they do not return
Ride southwest. Road runs in a trenchlike valley between the mountains and the moors. It is newly repaired for many miles
End of the slag heaps
Stop for the night. Camp along the road
Start ca. 8 a.m. Continue down the road
Road turns more to the south
Reach northern edge of Ithilien. East across road are dark trees. Closer ‘a tumbled heathland’ with ‘knots of pine-trees.’ Air is fresh and fragrant
Road is straight and level. Go more quickly
In valley between mountains on east and steep slopes on west
Woods appear to the west. Some growth begins along the road edges
Road crosses stream on an arched masonry bridge
Road becomes more overgrown. Camp along the road
Start ca. 8 a.m. Continue on Southward Road
Another stream is bridged
Reach north end of a long straight cutting through a stony ridge

Turn off the road. Climb west bank and go downhill. Many wounded now can walk. Some ride horses. Others are carried on litters. Many troops continue south on the road for return directly to Minas Tirith
Follow the nearby stream to the small clear pool visited 3 weeks before by Frodo and Sam. Troops find and cleanse nearby orc fire-ring
Troops stay north of stream. Descend steep slope
Thread their way through woodland, north of the stream channel
Trees grow thinner. The stream now runs “in a narrow gorge.”
Camp near Henneth Annûn. Some go to the caves for supplies
Continue downhill through woodland. Must skirt widely around the hollow of the waterfall.
Return to the stream. It still falls swiftly
Slope is more gentle. Trees begin to open out. The Anduin can be seen
Another stream joins on the southern shore
Reach the open, grassy flatlands by the Anduin: the Field of Cormallen
Set up camp with numerous pavilions.
Leave early. The Host goes south, taking boats down the Anduin
The south end of Cair Andros lies on the west, stream mouth on east
Stream enters on east
Can see Amon Dîn due west
Stream enters on east
Reach northern edge of Osgiliath. Continue down river to landings
Reach landings of Osgiliath. Dock and unload wounded
Mid-morning. Leave Osgiliath and go west along the Causeway
Reach the Causeway Forts on the Rammas Echor
Continue on the road across the Pelennor
Reach the Gates of Minas Tirith. Aragorn camps in the field
